sentences: Noel Scott Engel (January 9, 1943 – March 22, 2019) better known by the stage name Scott Walker, was a British-American singer-songwriter, composer and record producer who resided in England.
Walker was known for his baritone voice and an unorthodox career path which took him from 1960s teen pop icon to 21st-century avant-garde musician.
He lived in the UK from 1965 and became a UK citizen in 1970.
He lived in the UK from 1965 and became a UK citizen in 1970.

Rising to fame in the mid-1960s as frontman of the pop music trio the Walker Brothers, he began a solo career with 1967's Scott, moving toward an increasingly challenging style on late-1960s baroque pop albums such as Scott 3 and Scott 4 (both 1969).

Rising to fame in the mid-1960s as frontman of the pop music trio the Walker Brothers, he began a solo career with 1967's Scott, moving toward an increasingly challenging style on late-1960s baroque pop albums such as Scott 3 and Scott 4 (both 1969).
Walker's 1960s recordings were highly regarded by the 1980s UK underground music scene, and gained a cult following.
Walker's 1960s recordings were highly regarded by the 1980s UK underground music scene, and gained a cult following.
Walker continued to record until 2018.
Noel Scott Engel was born on January 9, 1943, in Hamilton, Ohio, US, the son of Elizabeth Marie (Fortier), who was from Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and Noel Walter Engel.

sentences: Engel was interested in both music and performance and spent time as a child actor and singer in the mid to late 1950s, including roles in two Broadway musicals, Pipe Dream and Plain and Fancy.

sentences: In 1961, after playing with the Routers, he met guitarist and singer John Maus, who was using the stage name John Walker on a fake ID to enable him to perform in clubs while under age.

== Life and career == | === 1975–1978: The Walker Brothers reunite ===

sentences: By the mid-1970s, Walker's career was at its nadir, and he joined back up with John Maus and Gary Leeds to revive the Walker Brothers in 1975.
section: == Life and career == | === 1975–1978: The Walker Brothers reunite ===

sentences: Their first comeback single, a cover of Tom Rush's song "No Regrets", from the album of the same title reached number 7 in the UK Singles Chart, some months after its release.
section: == Life and career == | === 1975–1978: The Walker Brothers reunite ===

sentences: With the imminent demise of their record label, the Walkers collaborated on an album of original material that was in stark contrast to the country-flavoured tunes of the previous 1970s albums.

sentences: The resulting album, Nite Flights, was released in 1978 with each of the Brothers writing and singing their own compositions.

section: == Life and career == | === 1975–1978: The Walker Brothers reunite ===

sentences: Walker died at the age of 76 in London on March 22, 2019.
section: == Death ==

sentences: His death was announced three days later by his record company 4AD, which announced cancer as the cause of death and called him "a unique and challenging titan at the forefront of British music".
section: == Death ==

sentences: Initially working as an interpreter of other people's songs, Scott Walker had developed his own songwriting skills by the heyday of the Walker Brothers and by the time of his first solo album in 1967.
section: == Artistry and compositional approach ==

sentences: In a 1984 interview he spoke of difficulty in writing songs: "I don't write songs for pleasure.

sentences: The roots of this compositional technique are apparent as early as the Scott Walker tracks on Nite Flights – the lyrics insert for the album clearly feature the technique, albeit with a black text on a white background.
section: == Artistry and compositional approach ==

sentences: Walker stated in the documentary film Scott Walker: 30 Century Man and in numerous interviews that for his entire career he has not listened to any of his own work after completion, either due to exhaustion from the project or self-criticism.
section: == Artistry and compositional approach ==

sentences: Many artists have expressed their admiration for Walker or cited him as an influence, including David Bowie, Alex Turner, Marc Almond, Bauhaus, Goldfrapp, Neil Hannon of The Divine Comedy, Julian Cope (who compiled the Fire Escape in the Sky: The Godlike Genius of Scott Walker compilation in 1981), Jarvis Cocker, Anohni, Thom Yorke and Radiohead, Steven Wilson of Porcupine Tree, and Mikael Åkerfeldt of Opeth (particularly expressed in their joint project Storm Corrosion), Tim Bowness of No-Man, Leonard Cohen, Efterklang, East India Youth, Kevin Hufnagel, Ihsahn, Russell Mills, Dennis Rea, John Baizley of Baroness, and Brian Eno.
